sense.def: be implemented; be acted on; be put into practice (ant. 廢 "be abandoned")
be earnest with respect to; make an earnest effort in relation to
manage to; get to perform an act, get to; have had a chance to
withdraw from the contextually determinate thing (e.g. public life)
=有所 have something which one Vs
LY: transmit (a tradition), aiming for deep understanding; SJ, preface: make a coherent account of something for a better understanding
semantically weak marker of a new beginning within a given discourse, often a summarising remark

seg.line: 其言化俗推移之理竭矣。

tls:text.tls:srcline: 其言化俗推移之理竭矣。

sense.def: exert a significant influence on; bring about a transformation; to change profoundly and essentially into something which is active or living, but substantially different; to make comply

sense.def: pattern of things, natural principle; Principle; reasonable principle, reason

tls:text.tls:line: people nowadays consider their use deceptive,

tls:text.tls:line: “I look upon your Way, our Master

sense.def: pay attention to, look upon; regard abstractly

tls:text.tls:line: “I look upon your Way, our Master
and I wonder how you achieved it so early in life?”

sense.def: How is it that S?, how was it that S?

and I wonder how you achieved it so early in life?”

sense.def: achieve the contextually determinate aim S

tls:text.tls:line: and I wonder how you achieved it so early in life?”

sense.def: to succeed; get one's way; derived from the transitive usage: to be completed

tls:text.tls:line: “When it comes to the Way, I had an aspiration for it.

sense.def: understand properly, have a sharp understanding of

tls:text.tls:line: “When it comes to the Way, I had an aspiration for it.

sense.def: aspiration for N; initiative for; concern for

tls:text.tls:line: “It is to use words that have concrete point and to act according to general rules.”

sense.def: content; distinct substantial meaning; concrete reference 言之有物

tls:text.tls:line: “That the Way won’t be practised is just inevitable.

sense.def: true system of teachings: Buddhist, Taoist, or traditional Confucian

tls:text.tls:line: “(Wait a minute:) but this is the crux of human-heartedness!”
